info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 11 at 10:28AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Light snow to continue through early this afternoon... Bands of light, to at times moderate, snow will continue along the Southern Rocky Mountain Front eastward into Cascade County. Snowfall rates have been as high as a half inch per hour and may result in additional accumulations up to 1 inch or so with the heavier bands. Lightly snow and ice covered roads have begun to show improvement as diurnal heating increases, but there will still be lingering icy spots heading into the afternoon, especially over Rogers and MacDonald Passes and other areas of higher terrain. Also expect visibility to fall below 1 mile at times. Anyone traveling in these areas should be prepared for wintry driving conditions through early this afternoon.
